scenarios.title: Missed Deadline Tension
scenarios.description: A colleague missed a deadline that affects your work. You're frustrated but want to address it constructively.
scenarios.context: Your colleague was supposed to deliver a report you need by Friday. It's now Monday and you still haven't received it. This has happened before.
scenarios.sampleOpening: Hey, I wanted to talk about the report that was due Friday...

scenarios.title: Receiving Critical Feedback
scenarios.description: Your manager gave you feedback that felt harsh. Practice processing it with self-empathy.
scenarios.context: In your performance review, your manager said your communication style can come across as abrupt. You feel hurt and defensive.
practiceGoals: Find the valid request underneath the criticism
scenarios.sampleOpening: I just got out of my review and I'm feeling pretty shaken...

scenarios.title: Overwhelming Workload
scenarios.description: You're taking on too much and need to set boundaries with your team.
scenarios.context: Your plate is overflowing with projects and a colleague just asked you to take on another task. You want to say no but feel guilty.
practiceGoals: Make a request that works for everyone
scenarios.sampleOpening: I appreciate you thinking of me for this project, but...

scenarios.title: Curfew Conversation
scenarios.description: Your teenager wants a later curfew. Practice empathetic dialogue while honoring your own needs.
scenarios.context: Your 16-year-old wants to stay out until midnight on weekends. You're worried about safety but also want to respect their growing independence.
practiceGoals: Find a solution that honors both perspectives
scenarios.sampleOpening: I hear that you want more freedom on weekends...

scenarios.title: Money Borrowed, Not Returned
scenarios.description: A sibling borrowed money months ago and hasn't mentioned repaying it. You want to address it without damaging the relationship.
scenarios.context: You lent your sister $500 six months ago when she was in a tough spot. She hasn't brought it up since and seems to have forgotten.
practiceGoals: Bring up the topic without accusation
scenarios.sampleOpening: I've been meaning to talk to you about something that's been on my mind...

scenarios.title: Aging Parent Care
scenarios.description: You're concerned about an aging parent's ability to live independently. Practice bringing up a difficult topic.
scenarios.context: Your 80-year-old father had a minor fall last week. You're worried about his safety living alone but know he values his independence fiercely.
practiceGoals: Lead with empathy for their experience
Share your concerns from a place of care
scenarios.sampleOpening: Dad, I've been thinking about you a lot since last week...

scenarios.title: Uneven Household Work
scenarios.description: You feel like you're doing more than your fair share of housework. Address it without triggering defensiveness.
scenarios.context: You've been doing most of the cooking and cleaning for weeks. Your partner doesn't seem to notice, and you're getting resentful.
scenarios.sampleOpening: I'd like to talk about how we're dividing things at home...

scenarios.title: Disconnection in Relationship
scenarios.description: You've been feeling distant from your partner lately and want to reconnect.
scenarios.context: Between work and life stress, you and your partner have been like ships passing in the night. You miss the closeness you used to have.
scenarios.sampleOpening: I've been missing you lately, even though we live together...

scenarios.title: Disagreement on Big Decision
scenarios.description: You and your partner disagree on a major life decision. Practice staying connected through conflict.
scenarios.context: Your partner wants to move to a new city for a job opportunity. You're happy where you are and don't want to leave your community.
practiceGoals: Share your own needs without ultimatums
scenarios.sampleOpening: I want to really understand what this opportunity means to you...

scenarios.title: Friend Who Always Cancels
scenarios.description: A friend frequently cancels plans last minute. Express how this affects you.
scenarios.context: For the third time this month, your friend cancelled plans the day of. You're starting to question if they value the friendship.
practiceGoals: Make a request that could work for both
scenarios.sampleOpening: I was really looking forward to seeing you yesterday...

scenarios.title: Setting a Boundary
scenarios.description: A friend keeps venting to you and it's becoming draining. Practice setting a compassionate boundary.
scenarios.context: Your friend calls you almost daily to complain about the same issues but doesn't take any action. You want to support them but you're exhausted.
practiceGoals: Be honest about your own limits
Propose a different way to connect
scenarios.sampleOpening: I care about you and what you're going through, and I also need to share something...

scenarios.title: Inner Critic Spiral
scenarios.description: Practice self-empathy when your inner critic is loud.
scenarios.context: You made a mistake at work and your inner voice is harsh: 'You're so stupid. You always mess things up.'
practiceGoals: Identify the needs behind the criticism
scenarios.sampleOpening: I can't stop beating myself up about what happened today...

scenarios.title: Procrastination Pattern
scenarios.description: Explore the needs behind procrastination with self-compassion.
scenarios.context: You've been putting off an important project for weeks. You feel bad about it but can't seem to get started.
practiceGoals: Find strategies that honor those needs
scenarios.sampleOpening: I keep telling myself I'll start tomorrow, but tomorrow never comes...

scenarios.title: Stuck on a Decision
scenarios.description: Practice connecting to your needs when facing a difficult choice.
scenarios.context: You're torn between two good options and can't decide. Both have pros and cons, and you feel paralyzed.
practiceGoals: Identify all the needs at play
Honor the wisdom in your indecision
Find what would help you move forward
scenarios.sampleOpening: I've been going back and forth on this decision for weeks...

scenarios.title: Being Interrupted in Meetings
scenarios.description: A colleague frequently interrupts you in meetings. Address it professionally.
scenarios.context: In team meetings, one colleague consistently talks over you or finishes your sentences. It's affecting your ability to contribute.
scenarios.sampleOpening: I've noticed something happening in our meetings that I'd like to discuss...
